title: [K-12] Culturally Inclusive Online Learning Design for Science Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic online learning tools and understanding of secondary science curriculum content
context.additional_context: Strengthening cultural inclusivity through inquiry- and collaboration-based learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

learning_goals: Learners propose three strategies for designing science lessons that account for cultural differences.
Learners analyze two cultural barriers that may arise when designing collaborative learning activities in mobile environments.
Learners develop one microlearning scenario per science subject by applying the WisCom framework.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
